title: [AMBARI-23035] HDFS Balancer via Ambari fails when FIPS mode is activated on the OS
body:
## What changes were proposed in this pull request?

This is similar issue as reported on AMBARI-22417, but for service checks.

```
ValueError: error:060800A3:digital envelope routines:EVP_DigestInit_ex:disabled for fips
```

The original issue of ambari check is resolved. But the same issue is seen when running the HDFS balancer via Ambari.

Solution
MD5 is disabled on the OS, Code needs to be updated to use SHA

This is required when FIPS mode is enabled on the RHEL OS

## How was this patch tested?

Manually tested in cluster, ran unit tests:

```
Total run:1046
Total errors:0
Total failures:0
OK
```

Please review [Ambari Contributing Guide](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/AMBARI/How+to+Contribute) before opening a pull request.

title: Dockerfiles for building Ambari (CentOS, Ubuntu)
body:
## What changes were proposed in this pull request?

Add a Docker-based environment for building Ambari on various OSes.  This grew out of a bug report that [RPM for Ambari cannot be built on CentOS 7](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AMBARI-22516).

The patch has:

 * Dockerfiles for building CentOS 6, CentOS 7 and Ubuntu 16.04 base images
 * Dockerfile with common additional steps (install specific Maven version)
 * a shell script to build and run any of those images (`start-build-env.sh`)

The script was slightly customized from Hadoop's [similar script](https://github.com/apache/hadoop/blob/71bbb86d69ac474596f5619d22718e9f7ff5f9dc/start-build-env.sh).  It runs the given command (eg. `mvn package`) in a non-root container, or just drops you into the container's shell if none given.  It takes advantage of the host's local Maven repository (`~/.m2`) via volume mount.



(Note: Ambari already has a Dockerfile, but it's CentOS 6-only, has a lot of excess baggage, and is outdated in many respects.)

## How was this patch tested?

Built a few modules:

```
$ BUILD_OS=centos6 ./start-build-env.sh mvn -am -pl ambari-admin,ambari-agent,ambari-server,ambari-web -B -fae -DskipTests -Dcheckstyle.skip -Drat.skip -Dfindbugs.skip -Del.log=WARN clean install
...
[INFO] BUILD SUCCESS
```

Built Agent and Server `.rpm`s on both CentOS 6 and 7, installed them on similar VirtualBox:

```
$ BUILD_OS=centos6 ./start-build-env.sh mvn -pl ambari-agent,ambari-server -B -fae -DskipTests -Dcheckstyle.skip -Drat.skip -Dfindbugs.skip -Del.log=WARN package rpm:rpm
...
[INFO] BUILD SUCCESS
...
$ find ambari-{agent,server}/target -name '*.rpm' | xargs -I FILE scp -q FILE c6401:
$ ssh c6401 'yum install -y ambari*rpm'
...
Installed:
  ambari-agent.x86_64 0:2.0.0.0-SNAPSHOT
  ambari-server.x86_64 0:2.0.0.0-SNAPSHOT
```

```
$ BUILD_OS=centos7 ./start-build-env.sh mvn -pl ambari-agent,ambari-server -B -fae -DskipTests -Dcheckstyle.skip -Drat.skip -Dfindbugs.skip -Del.log=WARN package rpm:rpm
...
[INFO] BUILD SUCCESS
...
$ find ambari-{agent,server}/target -name '*.rpm' | xargs -I FILE scp -q FILE c7301:
$ ssh c7301 'yum install -y ambari*rpm'
...
Installed:
  ambari-agent.x86_64 0:2.0.0.0-SNAPSHOT
  ambari-server.x86_64 0:2.0.0.0-SNAPSHOT
```

Built `.deb` packages, installed them on Ubuntu 16.04 VirtualBox:

```
$ BUILD_OS=ubuntu16 ./start-build-env.sh mvn -pl ambari-agent,ambari-server -B -fae -DskipTests -Dcheckstyle.skip -Drat.skip -Dfindbugs.skip -Del.log=WARN -Dpackage-version=2.0.0.0 -Dpackage-release=SNAPSHOT package jdeb:jdeb
...
[INFO] BUILD SUCCESS
...
$ find ambari-{agent,server}/target -name '*.deb' | xargs -I FILE scp -q FILE u1601:
$ ssh u1601 'dpkg -i ambari-agent_2.0.0.0-SNAPSHOT.deb ambari-server_2.0.0.0-SNAPSHOT-dist.deb'
...
Setting up ambari-agent (2.0.0.0-SNAPSHOT) ...
Setting up ambari-server (2.0.0.0-SNAPSHOT) ...
...
```

Tested with custom `MAVEN_VERSION`:

```
$ BUILD_OS=centos6 MAVEN_VERSION=3.5.2 ./start-build-env.sh
...
centos6:~/src $ mvn --version
Apache Maven 3.5.2 (138edd61fd100ec658bfa2d307c43b76940a5d7d; 2017-10-18T07:58:13Z)
```

title: [AMBARI-22962] - Ambari Upgrade: LogSearch + Ambari Infra (2.6 -> 2.7)
body:
## What changes were proposed in this pull request?

Rename service AMBARI_INFRA to AMBARI_INFRA_SOLR
- in metainfo.xml of AMBARI_INFRA
- in kerberos.json
- kerberos_descriptor json in the artifact table in ambari database
- in ambari database table records
- in role command order

Move from AMBARI_INFRA folder from AMBARI_INFRA_SOLR in common_services and stacks/HDP

Fixed logsearch upgrade: when upgrading ambari the each logsearch releated configuration tried to be deleted multiple times because of different configuration versions. From the second all tries failed and broke the upgrade.

## How was this patch tested?

1. Install Ambari 2.6.1
2. Create cluster including zookeeper, logsearch and ambari infra
3. Enable Kerberos
4. Start upgrade Ambari to 2.7.0.2
5. Before running ambari-server upgrade build ambari-server from trunk, and replace ambari-server.jar and the stack code
6. Continue upgrade
7. Run service checks
8. Regenerate keytabs
9. Run service checks

Please review:

title: AMBARI-23012. "Stale Alerts" alert appears on cluster after some time…
body:
**Background:**
Previously. Every x seconds any alert was updated with information from agent. Even if nothing changed.
Due to perf reasons this behavior was changed so that agent reports alerts only when their status changes.

**Issue:**
Due this change, "stale alerts" alert started appearing on clusters, showing that alerts were not updated for a long time.

**Solution:**
We should consider alert up-to-date to the point of last heartbeat. Which shows that the connection between server and agent is okay due to last_hb_timestamp, and so agent could send alert updates.

title: [AMBARI-22998] Wrong user used to execute the Spark/Livy Server service check
body:
## What changes were proposed in this pull request?

**_common-services/SPARK/1.2.1/package/scripts/service_check.py:36_**
```
 livy_kinit_cmd = format("{kinit_path_local} -kt {smoke_user_keytab} {smokeuser_principal}; ")
 Execute(livy_kinit_cmd, user=params.livy_user)
```
Notice the Kerberos identity is for the smoke user, but the exec is for the livy user. This will replace the livy user's interactive Kerberos ticket cache.

This should be 
```
smoke_user_kinit_cmd = format("{kinit_path_local} -kt {smoke_user_keytab} {smokeuser_principal}; ")
Execute(smoke_user_kinit_cmd, user=params.smoke_user)
```
Where `smoke_user` is
```
smoke_user =  config['configurations']['cluster-env']['smokeuser']
```

**This is similar for SPARK2 as well.** 

## How was this patch tested?

Tested manually with original code to see the issue and then fix the fixed code to see it working properly:


body:
## What changes were proposed in this pull request?

These tests require that a mocked ViewRegistry be used, which is set in a static initializer block. If the ViewRegistry is set after that, for example, but running a test in one of these classes, then the tests will no longer be using the correct ViewRegistry. Therefore, I have changed the set up methods of these test classes to set the ViewRegistry to the mocked version from that class.

Patch was tested manually.

title: [AMBARI-22993]. Get rid of overriding solr start script during infra solr build
body:
## What changes were proposed in this pull request?
During creation of infra solr rpm, we download the solr tarball and override the start script in that in order to use line/space separated kerberos name rules for Solr (which is passed through infra-solr-env.sh)

To get rid of that, there is a workaround: if we passes the `solr.kerberos.name.rules` property directly where we calling the start script, that can be parsed properly (but not with `-a` option, which is used for additional parameters)

For that reason I removed the SOLR_KERB_NAME_RULES from infra-solr-env.sh template (wont require upgrade as it wont be used by the start script anyway), and execute solr script differently during infra solr start (based on security is enabled or not)

## How was this patch tested?

[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------

[INFO] Final Memory: 100M/1080M
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------

FT: done - vagrant, start solr without solr script change + stack changes (used multiple rules)

Rules were: RULE:[2:$1@$0](.*@EXAMPLE.COM)s/@.*// RULE:[2:$1@$0](.*@AMBARI.APACHE.ORG)s/@.*//

AMBARI.APACHE.ORG was the correct one, components could speak Solr, after that i changed that value and i have seen the rule not matching error as expected

title: Upgrade Ambari to Guice 4.1
body:
## What changes were proposed in this pull request?

As more Java 8 code is added in Ambari, it becomes ever harder to find the root cause of problems that come up during Injector creation (eg. missing bindings or [JPA/DB issues](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AMBARI-22938)).  Guice 3 usually shows an [ArrayIndexOutBoundsException](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/28244342/why-is-a-lambda-expression-breaking-guice-error-handling-when-i-try-to-start-jet/) instead of the actual problem.

Guice 4.0 added [Java8 runtime compatibility](https://github.com/google/guice/wiki/Guice40#some-highlights).  Current version is [4.1](https://github.com/google/guice/wiki/Guice41), released June 17, 2016.

## How was this patch tested?

Built RPMs, installed them on CentOS6 and deployed a minimal kerberized ZooKeeper cluster.

title: [AMBARI-21738][WIP] OS specific package manager logic need to be moved out from Package provider to ambari_commons
body:
## What changes were proposed in this pull request?

Moving and cleaning Package manager internals from resource provider to ambari-commons, by making Resource clean and transparent proxy to ambari-commons package

Sub-tasks: 
- let ambari_commons.shell handle all system/subprocess calls instead of bundling it with package logic
- provide seamless experience with using any provider and possibility to add new one (like for working with tars, etc)
- clean and re-organize code  
- do not broke external Package resource interface 
- open possibility to use native yum api on root agents instead of parsing output


## How was this patch tested?

This is only preview, which is not currently working.

title: [AMBARI-22966] ambari-agent fails to start (dgrinenko)
body:
## What changes were proposed in this pull request?

RM wildcard module resolving cased `sudo` module to be imported twice, causing circular import issue. Moving `sudo` import inside function will help to broke  circular import chain.

## How was this patch tested?
Before:
```
# ambari-agent start
Verifying Python version compatibility...
Using python  /usr/bin/python
Checking for previously running Ambari Agent...
Checking ambari-common dir...
Starting ambari-agent
Verifying ambari-agent process status...
ERROR: ambari-agent start failed. For more details, see /var/log/ambari-agent/ambari-agent.out:
====================
  File "/usr/lib/ambari-agent/lib/resource_management/__init__.py", line 23, in <module>
    from resource_management.libraries import *
  File "/usr/lib/ambari-agent/lib/resource_management/libraries/__init__.py", line 23, in <module>
    from resource_management.libraries.functions import *
  File "/usr/lib/ambari-agent/lib/resource_management/libraries/functions/__init__.py", line 48, in <module>
    from resource_management.libraries.functions.log_process_information import *
  File "/usr/lib/ambari-agent/lib/resource_management/libraries/functions/log_process_information.py", line 22, in <module>
    from ambari_commons.shell import shellRunner
ImportError: cannot import name shellRunner
====================
Agent out at: /var/log/ambari-agent/ambari-agent.out
Agent log at: /var/log/ambari-agent/ambari-agent.log
```

After: 

```
# ambari-agent start
Verifying Python version compatibility...
Using python  /usr/bin/python
Checking for previously running Ambari Agent...
Checking ambari-common dir...
Starting ambari-agent
Verifying ambari-agent process status...
Ambari Agent successfully started
Agent PID at: /var/run/ambari-agent/ambari-agent.pid
Agent out at: /var/log/ambari-agent/ambari-agent.out
Agent log at: /var/log/ambari-agent/ambari-agent.log
```
